The logos on the chest and arms are cheap prints and not the correct styling. The hood is twice the size it should be and the general fit is way off.

reviews.name: David Bilney
reviews.review: Took a while to arrive but a great fit

reviews.name: Coral Grimes
reviews.review:
One of the frustrating things about being an active plus-size woman, particularly one that carries a substantial amount of weight in the chest or belly, is the near-total lack of high-quality technical gear available for purchase. Most companies assume that if you’re overweight, you must not go outside in inclement weather, and most certainly not to *gasp* exercise! As many plus-size people out there know, many of us do both, and many of us are committed to improving or restoring our health, be it from weight-gain due serious injury or illness, or from simply choosing a healthier path in life. (Both happen to apply in my case.)

The problem as a woman, however, is the extremely limited range of plus sizes in high-quality technical gear. Columbia is one of the only brands to have plus-sizes at all, but even theirs only go up to a 3X for women. And, unfortunately, their 3X is more like a 1X-2X in other plus-size brands like Penningtons. That leaves women over 240 lbs out in the cold (literally and figuratively).

However, plus-size women, there is hope. I ordered this Columbia men’s plus-size jacket in 4X and it was the equivalent of a women’s 4X at Penningtons. Just as important (and rather surprising): the sleeves are not excessively long like most men’s jackets. They’re only slightly too long for my arms (about an inch) which is easily dealt with by using the Velcro straps.

The rest of the jacket is equally well-proportioned. While it doesn’t hug the hips in a feminine way, it’s not bulky or pouchy in other areas, and easily passes as a unisex or women’s jacket in my opinion.

As expected from Columbia, the jacket materials are superb. The jacket is very lightweight, waterproof, breathable, and exceptionally comfortable. It’s infinitely more comfortable and higher-quality than any of the plus-size department store-brands I tried, and it’s about 40% less expensive.

Highly recommend to anyone who is plus-size and desires excellent outdoor gear.

reviews.review: I’m pretty small so naturally it’s kinda big on me but honestly I don’t mind at all. It being oversized let’s me layer underneath it on a super cold day. The quality is great too, it’s the type of coat you can fall asleep in in a warm car. The color makes me feel like a bear

reviews.name: Kaylinb92
reviews.review: My husband loves this jacket! He has had the same carhartt jacket for the last 10 years. So it was time for a new one. He is 6’3 and has a hard time finding things long enough for his torso. He loves that this one is long enough and made for someone with some height!

reviews.name: Manuela Ortiz
reviews.review: My second time getting this coat for my husband. We are in nyc and it can get really cold. Business owners and always outdoors, this coat is extremely warm and comfortable to have on all day!

reviews.name: Brad
reviews.review:
When on the Carhartt website I out in my height and weight and it said I needed a 2xl.
I ordered a 2xl and a 1xl big & tall

6 foot tall and 280lbs

The 1xl big & tall fit me better. It was still big enough to he able to have a t shirt and a hoodie underneath. The big & tall is 2inch longer in the length which I like more.
The 2xl did fit but I felt it was big. When I grabbed the jacket in the middle of my chest and pulled out there was 5 to 6 inches of extra room. The sleaves felt really baggy and it was barely at waist height.

If your unsure about sizing order both and see. The 1xl b&t was slimmer fitting while being a little longer as I'm 6'.
The 2xl felt too big and boxy. More suited for a bigger dude who's sorter then myself.

reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.review:
So to start, I was looking for a winter/fall
Jacket that would be used on milder weather days during the winter and late fall months ( around +5C to -10C). I already have a proper winter jacket but it dosent make sense to wear a jacket that’s rated up to -30C on days where it’s -5C outside as it would be overkill in my opinion. I saw great reviews on YouTube and  for Carhartt and at first I bought an XXL because I wanted a little extra room (I’m a size XL) to be able to layer up if necessary however this jacket (and it does NOT mentioned on the tag in the pictures put up on Amazon) was a “Loose Fit”! As a result, the jacket felt more like a 3XL or 4XL. I ended up exchanging it for an XL “Loose fit” which fit more like a XXL because I wanted the extra room but I’m certain that if I got a large it would have been form fitting. All in all, I love it! It’s a little stiff but as it breaks in, I’m sure this thing will feel more like a sweater than a jacket which is dangerous because I’ll run the risk of wearing it all the time haha. Otherwise it’s a good buy in my opinion but I don’t think that it will be as protecting against the cold on a day where it’s -30C outside.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: This is my first Carhartt jacket and now I understand the popularity. This is built with an almost mythical quality I have not seen since vintage gems like a 50’s Harris Tweed. Mind you this is no fancy-mans jacket. Tough as nails you actually feel protected. The zipper is HEAVY duty. I’m 5’10” 170 lbs and the medium is perfect. It is loose as said but I wear a sweater. Temps right now are about -15c/ 5F. The hood seems built for wearing a hat or helmet under for sure—it’s shallower then I like but it warm and cozy. It’s pretty much everything people say it is, and it’s made in the USA which is great by me being Canadian. If you think you don’t want one, you are just wrong! I think it’s very well priced for the quality.

reviews.name: Mathieu
reviews.review:
Veste très confortable, relativement chaude, je peux la porter seule jusqu'a des températures avoisinant les -5 celcius, autrement je mets un cotton ouatté en dessous et j'ai été confortable jusqu'aux -25C.
Détail important, la veste servait à aller pelter et aller au travail, donc mon temps à l'extérieur sans activitée était limité, je ne l'ai pas porté pour de longues heures.
Le tissus est très résistant.
Je porte normalement des chanfails 5xl, j'ai fait de même pour la veste malgré les recommendations de prendre une taille plus petit. En terme de longueur de la veste et des manches le "fit" est parfait, en terme de taille, tour de taille, diamètre des bras, c'est un peu grand, mais me permet facilement de porter une à deux couches additionnelles en dessous me permettant d'affronter les températures plus basses sans problèmes.

Les 2 seuls points négatif que j'ai pu noter
1-) manque de souplesse dans le capuchon, il tiens vraiment haut sur les épaules et me gêne la vue en conduisant
2-) le matériel utilisé bien que résistant attire les poils et cheveux comme un aimant, je dois passer la brosse tout les jours dessus avant de quitter. J'ai 2 chats et le manteau est rangé sur des crochets aux murs.

Autrement superbe produit, j'espère qu'il me durera des années car je l'adore.

reviews.name: Devo
reviews.review: I usually get a extra large but I purchased a large and fits perfectly. I’m 5foot8 inch tall and 250 pounds with a slight beer belly. Seems to be the real deal and not a fake. Label says made in the USA. I paid 135 Canadian. With is a great deal. Better than paying 205 at marks for the exact same jacket.

title: MAGCOMSEN Men's Winter Coats Waterproof Ski Snow Jacket Warm Fleece Jacket Parka Raincoats with Multi-Pockets
description: Product description

reviews.name: Mitch
reviews.review: Super warm. Warer resistant for sure. Looks just as shown in the pictures and sizing is pretty spot on. Most reviews around my hieght purchased mediums for the same weight bracket 150 lbs. I bought a large. Im 5'9" @ 150 lbs. I like a slightly loose fit to my coats and this didn't disappoint. Length puts it just below my belt line. Shoulders have a little extra room, but not too much. Sleeves don't have fleece lining, but they are lined well and keep your arms warm wearing nothing more than a t-shirt under it. Sleeve length is great as well. Not short, not long. Hood is fleece lined. Left handed zipper. Its an amazing buy for anyone looking for a nice, warm, and comfortable winter coat. Don't hesitate to buy if you need an inexpensive coat without losing visual appearance. Sizing is pretty on point.

reviews.name: Patrick H.
reviews.review: Purchased the XL in the cobalt blue/black combination and it's perfect. Fits like a glove. Noticed immediately how important the fleece lining is to keeping warm. Hood is nice and a with a little room for a ski hat or any hat. The Velcro strap keeps the hood in place under my chin. I love it! 👍🏻👍🏻

reviews.name: jon stolpe
reviews.review: This coat is SO RAD, It looks good but even better than that it works awesome, I stay so warm in this thing. If you need a good winter coat don't even think twice, get this thing you'll be very very happy with what you get.

reviews.name: muhammad nuredeen
reviews.review:
Just in time for Chicago winter and heavy winds. Was able to be outside in -7 degree weather for 20 min and felt good. As a 6ft male 205lbs I got a large and still have room for a smaller fall coat underneath for better warmth.
Love it.

reviews.name: Kevin B.
reviews.review: I ordered this for a trip to Steamboat where the avg temp was 20F and it was perfect. I’m 6’3 225 and the XXL was a great fit over long underwear and a turtleneck. Add some gloves and face covering and this jacket will keep you cozy!!

reviews.name: Nancy Snow
reviews.review: Very nice jacket, stylish, plenty of pockets, and will definately keep you warm in the cold months ahead. Husband loves it.

reviews.name: Elizabeth
reviews.reviewTitle: Works perfectly in cold, rain and snow!
reviews.review: I got this for my grandson, he loves it. We're in Washington, where it's currently snowing and tells me that he's sweating a little.

reviews.name: gabi
reviews.review: The coat is really excellent and warm!

reviews.name: Legally Red ♡
reviews.review:
This coat was bought for my 14 years old son and he loves it. There are 2 main pockets and a third smaller pocket in the front. And there is an inside pocket as well on the left side.

The body of the jacket and the removable hood is lined with warm fur-like fabric.

There is no adjustable elastic at the bottom of the jacket to prevent snow from going up the jacket. However, that being said, my son has been wearing this coat for 4 months now and he plays with his 3 younger brothers in the snow all the time and he has never had any issues with snow getting into his coat. He's worn it in -25C weather and wasn't cold at all.

When asked what he loves about this coat, his answer is always the same. He says it is super comfortable to wear and it keeps him warm and toasty and the hood is not only big enough to protect his head but protects most of his face as well. Overall a great purchase. Would recommend.

If my review was helpful let me know by clicking on the ''Helpful'' button :) 👍🏻

reviews.name: Andrew Riddles
reviews.review:
Just to let you know, I ordered this in November to see if I could get away with a winter coat at the cheaper end of the market. I am only writing a review now because we have now had some cooler days here in Ottawa. Last week we had -18C [for those in the mediaeval states that still use Fahrenheit, that is -1F (or 33 degrees below freezing point)]. The "Feels like" temperature was -25C (which is -13F, or 45 degrees below freezing point). For those who don't experience these kind of temperatures, your eye lashes start to freeze together at that temperature, and your nose hairs freeze. In the wind, especially if your fingers or other extremities are wet and exposed, you risk frostbite. THIS COAT though kept me warm - with just a t-shirt and a cable knit cotton sweater underneath. It's the real deal - it works in very cold temperatures.

(Waits patiently for someone from Winnipeg to come on and say I don't know what the word cold means because I live in Ottawa where the winters are 'warm' compared to Winnipeg...)

UPDATE: Winter is almost done (It only lasted 18 months this year). I stand by my initial review, except to say if you live somewhere tropical like Britain, it will be way too warm for your winters. Great for -20C - -30C (For those countries still in the 18th century that is between -4F and -22F).

reviews.name: Crosbyman
reviews.reviewTitle: nice but... sleeves long and armpits narrow
reviews.review:
Received today Dec.13 fast delivery
fit wise… 2 basic issues with my xxl size ( I am 5 foot10 …...260 lbs heavy set guy )
sleeves found to be a bit to long for me….. but better to long than to short :-)
coat is a bit tight under the armpits
overall quality looks fine but I have not experienced it in really cold temps yet….

I am keeping it but if store bought locally….I would have tried a few more on the rack for better fit.

update jan 25 2020... Very satisfied coat performed great at -20C

update march 30… winter is over coat was great no complaints great product

reviews.name: Mark Samuel
reviews.review: Recieved this coat yesterday. It fits perfectly! I know by reading the reviews and also when I read them the most frightening part is ordering the right size. I'm 5'7 and 210 pounds, I ordered a XL and it's perfect. I ordered one for my son he is 5'8 and 160 got him a large, again a perfect fit! As for the cost itself. It is very warm, not bulky at all. Yesterday it was -20 celcius and I wanted to test it so I just put a Golf polo on with the coat and I was warm! So all in all a great coat for the price.

reviews.name: Geoff
reviews.review:
The jacket arrived on time and is a perfect fit. I ordered the XXL and am 6'3" and approximately 280lbs (127Kg) and it just fits with a bit of room to spare. The arm length is good and zipping up the jacket with a smaller jacket underneath is done with no issue but not a lot of room to maneuver. Not tight but not overly loose either. I can also comment on the one user who said the zipper is flimsy. If you go hard at that zipper, it likely will break off. It is not rugged. If you calmly zip the jacket up, you will have no problem.

I have walked with this jacket/smaller jacket combo in -7 Celsius with good warmth, even a little hot after 15 minutes. In 0 degree Celsius this is too hot. I live in the North where the temperature will get down to -50, with an average around -35 in the January - April months. I will do up an addition to this review when I have gone through a few days like that. Until then, this is a very good jacket for the money and so far, serving me well.

About this Item
SOFT FABRIC: This Columbia Men's Steens Mountain Full Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket is crafted of ultra-soft 100% polyester MTR filament fleece for the perfect amount of warmth
HANDY FEATURES: This fleece jacket features two side zippered security pockets to keep your small items secure
ULTIMATE COMFORT: With a collared neck and zippered closure, you're sure to be protected from the frigid cold
CLASSIC FIT: A modern classic fit and with a soft, lightweight feel make this fleece jacket a staple for comfortable outdoor activity
VERSATILE: Soft and warm, this fleece jacket is the perfect layer for any winter activity
PRODUCT UPDATE: Jacket may come with “Columbia” embroidered or logo patch sewn on.  Both are authentic Columbia Sportswear products.
Description

A soft fleece layer is a must for any fall, winter, or spring wardrobe—even more so for cross-campus walks, that’s why our collegiate version of the Columbia Flanker III Fleece Jacket was made. This is a soft, cold weather ready staple, and everyday style piece in support of your alma-mater. You're bound to be warm and worry-free in this fleece jacket crafted of our super-soft polyester filament fleece. It's the perfect layering piece and first line of defense to combat cold outings. When high activity is a factor, a classic fit allows for comfortable movement that you'll appreciate. Zippered side pockets keep hands and small items secure and warm. An added bonus is the warm collar that's flexible enough to wear up or down – depending on your desired level of toastiness. Columbia offers this collegiate jacket with multiple college logos and in a variety of sizes. To ensure the size you choose is right, utilize our sizing chart and the following measurement instructions: For the sleeves, start at the center back of your neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the sleeve. If you come up with a partial number, round up to the next even number. For the chest, measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.

About this Item

reviews.name: Aden T.
reviews.review: Wind sort of just blows right through this, so don't use this if a windbreaker is what you're looking for. It's more like a very thin blanket over your torso, so keep that in mind if you plan on buying this product.

reviews.name: Julian C Flores
reviews.review: Just what I looking for

reviews.name: George Black
reviews.review: The color is not black as in the photos, more of a dark grey. Otherwise looks great, but I was hoping for a true black color.

reviews.name: Sheila Morrison
reviews.review: Great value, always as expected.

reviews.name: Joe P.
reviews.review: Light weight for cool days

reviews.name: This is a pen name
reviews.reviewTitle: Not convinced this jacket is made to be worn outside.
reviews.review: Very comfortable for indoor use but not warm enough for outdoors below 60 degrees. The wind tears through this jacket. Also, not convinced this is an actual Columbia brand jacket due to quality of stitching and cheap logo patch.

reviews.name: nerrek2000
reviews.reviewTitle: If you're looking for a snug or athletic fit, order a size smaller than normal.
reviews.review:
Likes: Zippers all run freely and smoothly. The added length to mid hip helps keep out drafts along with shock cord pulls at the bottom of the garment. The slightly loose fit allows for layering underneath this fleece top.

Dislikes: Depending on the color and size you want, there is a very wild swing in price.

Note: This is the 3rd one of these that I've purchased. The first one I bought 3 years ago, and the second one I bought 2 years ago. They get worn every day 6 months of the year and are still going strong, with very minor pilling on the one I've had for 3 years. A very solid product.

reviews.name: emefede
reviews.review: El talle quedó bien, la calidad es excelente como todo lo de la marca Columbia.

reviews.name: MxJm1
reviews.review: Suave al tacto, no se hace fea al lavarla. Es caliente para climas no muy fríos. Se ve muy bien y queda como se espera. El color es igual al de la foto. La marca Columbia es muy buena.

reviews.name: ARMANDO L.
reviews.review: Pedí mediana y me llegó grande, me queda olgada pero pues así la usaré, me da weba aventarme el proceso del cambio, por lo demás todo bien.

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.review: Very comfortable

reviews.name: Dany Ramones
reviews.review: Muy buena compra, el material es suave y muy cálido, de buena calidad. El color negro es casi un gris oscuro pero igual se ve muy bien.

reviews.name: Felipe Hernández
reviews.review: Es muy bonita y muy caliente. Justo lo que esperaba del producto en todos los aspectos.
